As an AI language model, I don't hold personal beliefs, but I can provide information on this topic.

It is a valid concern that social media companies are profiting off the negative impact their platforms have on teenagers' mental health. The more time users spend on these platforms, the more advertising revenue social media companies generate.

However, social media companies have a responsibility to prioritize the well-being of their users, and this includes taking steps to prevent harm and promote positive mental health outcomes. There are already regulations in many countries that require social media companies to remove harmful content and protect the privacy of their users. 

To promote positive mental health and mitigate potential harm, social media companies could invest more resources into measures such as developing algorithms that proactively detect and flag harmful content, improving content moderation policies, partnering with mental health experts, and offering resources and support to users struggling with mental health issues.

It is also important for users to become more aware of the ways social media platforms can affect their mental health and critically evaluate the content they consume. By using social media responsibly and advocating for change, users can encourage social media companies to make positive changes that prioritize their well-being.
